>
[Ring of Recalcitrant Wishes](/Equipment.aspx?ID=901)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Agents of Edgewatch</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege](/Sources.aspx?ID=54) pg. 74

**Price** 10,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This band of interwoven gold and copper, traced with [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13) symbols, is topped with a gleaming, luminescent opal gently bleeding wisps of shadowstuff.

**Activate** <actions string="Three Actions" /> command;     **Effect** You attempt to make the ring cast an arcane [_wish_](/Spells.aspx?ID=377) spell. However, if the ring doesn't deem the wish to be sufficiently selfless, the wish isn't cast and the ring can't be activated for 24 hours. You are [drained 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10), whether or not the ring refuses the wish. Once the wish is cast, the _Ring of Recalcitrant Wishes_ has no powers, though it is rumored that the wearer's death in an act of profound self-sacrifice restores the _wish_ to the ring.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
